comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2086?focusedCommentId=16352718) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Python 3.5 was released on September 13, 2015.  Python 3.4 is only receiving security fixes. Is it worthwhile to continue producing builds for 3.4?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2086?focusedCommentId=16352986) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 1555
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1555>

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2086?focusedCommentId=16354153) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Seems like Pandas and NumPy are also dropping 3.4 so probably we should drop it too.
